column1: Uchi////Had an amazing night at Uchi. The place was packed
column2: but there was open seating at the wine bar. The servers are extremely knowledgeable about the menu items
column3: even describing the preparation. I was impressed that they recommended a sequence of my sushi selections - light to rich flavor. I never felt like the service was pretentious. Instead it was like having dinner with people who really
column4: really love and appreciate food. I had fun trying new textures and flavors. Highlights of the evening were hama chili
column6: and madai (sea breem). Save the foie nigiri for last. It's a memorable end to an amazing experience.
